definition: to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa

sentences.english: LeiTuos servant savannah untold hardships to find merlin to give him a prophecy.
sentences.chinese: 阿雷陀的仆人芬娜千辛万苦去找梅林要给他预言。

sentences.english: After experiencing lots of bitterness and sorrow, they finally reached the West.
sentences.chinese: 两人历经千辛万苦，终于到达西天。

sentences.english: Mary had a hard time finishing all the reading tasks.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽费尽千辛万苦才把阅读的任务完成。

sentences.english: The pioneers endured many hardships in setting the west.
sentences.chinese: 那些拓荒者在开发西部时历经了千辛万苦。

sentences.english: This is why we go to the extent to import ingredients from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这是为什么我们千辛万苦也要从海外进口材料。

sentences.english: I've gone to a great deal of trouble to get you back.
sentences.chinese: 我经历了千辛万苦才找把你弄回来。

sentences.english: After innumerable hardships, the prospecting team discovered a lot of new ores.
sentences.chinese: 地质勘探队员们历尽千辛万苦，找到了不少新矿藏。

sentences.english: Still, the Prince eventually stumbled upon that remote corner.
sentences.chinese: 然而王子历尽千辛万苦，最终找到了这个地方。

sentences.english: National leaders spend much of their efforts trying to get warring factions to commit to peace again.
sentences.chinese: 国家领袖千辛万苦地使敌对的各方能重新和平共处。

definition: to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out

pinyin: jiu3 niu2 er4 hu3 zhi1 li4

definition: to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
(idiomatic usage) with great difficulty/to have a hard time (convincing sb, relinquishing sth etc)/(literal usage) so easy
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
to travel over land and water (idiom)
(adverbial phrase used with verbs such as 歸|归[gui1] or 赴[fu4] etc) traveling a great distance
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
